page.title: 11IMPACT OF RAF LEUCHARS
page.content: The Royal Air Force base in Leuchars village plays a major role in supplying a great deal of employment to the district. In May 1985 the base employed approximatly 1,400 men and women, their average age being 32. The base plays a substantial part in the defence of the United Kingdom. Obviously one of the major problems for the community is the noise level. About 3 years ago the Fife Regional Council gave a grant to house-holders in the direct vicinity of the base to supply their houses with double -glazing. Of the 9 people that we inteviewed, only 2 were bothered with the noise, these people having young babies. Another problem for house-holders and the RAF's property is the structural damage that the noise from the aircraft causes, eg cracked walls and dislodged roof tiles
